sections.title: MBBS Admission in Uttar Pradesh 2025-26, Colleges Seat Matrix, Fee Structure, Application process, cut-off and Counselling

content.content: Uttar Pradesh is a bustling center of industry, innovation, and education, celebrated for its vibrant culture, storied past, and significant economic contributions to India. Its capital.

Renowned as a premier destination for medical education in India, Uttar Pradesh offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate medical programs, drawing students from all corners of the nation. Admission to MBBS programs in Uttar Pradesh is conducted through the NEET exam, with successful candidates participating in state counseling for enrollment.

The MBBS curriculum in Uttar Pradesh spans 5.5 years, comprising 4.5 years of academic study and 1 year of compulsory internship, providing students with comprehensive training and practical experience.In Uttar Pradesh aspiring MBBS students have a variety of options available for admission. The state boasts both government and private medical colleges and universities. Typically, securing admission into government medical colleges is more competitive than private ones, resulting in higher cut-off marks for government institutions.

The total number of MBBS seats in Uttar Pradesh can vary each year due to factors such as government policies, changes in infrastructure, and accreditation of new medical colleges. For MBBS Admission Uttar Pradesh 2025 total 8485 seats are available in Government and Private Medical Colleges in Uttar Pradesh. The state has 2 AIIMS College and 33 Government and 32 Private Medical Colleges.

In the following sections, we will delve into the specifics of MBBS admission for the academic year 2025-26 in Uttar Pradesh including details on college seat matrix, fee structure, application process, cut-off marks, and counseling procedures. For personalized assistance with MBBS admission in India or abroad, feel free to reach out to our dedicated admission counseling team at MBBS APP.

Uttar Pradesh has a total of 70 medical colleges, including 33 government medical colleges, 2 AIIMS (All India Institute of Medical Sciences), 2 central universities, 1 Deemed university and 32 private medical colleges. The government medical colleges offer 4553 MBBS seats, while the private medical colleges offer 5600 MBBS seats.

content.table:
Application modeOnline

Entrance ExamNational Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET)

content.content: The NEET cutoff is determined based on various factors such as the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the exam, and the availability of seats in medical and dental colleges. It varies for different categories like General, OBC, SC, ST, and others. Each state and college may also have its own cutoff scores. Generally, higher cutoffs are seen in prestigious colleges and for popular courses. It’s crucial for aspiring medical students to keep track of cutoff trends and prepare accordingly

sections.title: Uttar Pradesh MBBS Admission 2025-26: College wise Cut-off

content.content: DMET, Lucknow will release the NEET 2025 cut-off for the State Quota seats in Uttar Pradesh in online mode. The following are a not many significant focuses that should be remembered. 85% of the seats under the State Quota will be allotted to qualifying applicant from various gatherings like OBC, SC, ST, EWS and Unreserved. Hopeful candidates looking for confirmation through the State Quota should choose and lock their favoured colleges choices at the hour of NEET 2025 guiding enlistment. To get confirmation under State Quota applicant should be an inhabitant of Uttar Pradesh.

sections.title: Uttar Pradesh MBBS Admission 2025-26: Application Form

content.list:
• The application form must be filled out entirely online. Only online application fees are accepted from students.
  • The Uttar Pradesh MBBS Admission Application Form is now available, and candidates can submit their applications till the deadline.
  • In order to register for the Uttar Pradesh MBBS 2025 application form, applicants must input their personal, academic, NEET 2025 score, and other information. The authority will announce the merit ranking and adhere to the procedure of document verification, choice-filling, and place-allocation.
  • Candidates must bring a hard copy of their admissions application along with all Original Documents when they report to the designated medical or dental college; otherwise, their application will be rejected/disqualified without further communication.

sections.title: Uttar Pradesh MBBS Admission 2025-26: Application Fee

content.content: UP NEET UG Counselling is conducted for 85% of state quota seats and 100% of private college seats in MBBS/BDS courses offered by medical and dental colleges of Uttar Pradesh. The counselling process is conducted online by DGME UP in multiple rounds.Application fees for NEET UG Counselling can be paid online through the official website of DGME UP (Directorate of Medical Education and Training, Uttar Pradesh) during the registration window for each counselling round. Category wise application fee for UP NEET UG Counselling is as follows:

content.table:
Student CategoryApplication Fees
General CategoryRs. 1600
EWS and OBCRs. 1500
SC/ ST/ PHRs. 900

content.content: Note- This fee can be paid online through the official website of DGME UP (Directorate of Medical Education and Training, Uttar Pradesh) during the registration window for each counselling round.

sections.title: MBBS Admission Uttar Pradesh Eligibility Criteria

content.content: The candidates ought to have the qualification measures to encourage affirmation inside the Uttar Pradesh MBBS and BDS and furthermore, the qualification standards are referenced underneath.

content.list:
• Only the NEET scored applicants can get admission in UP MBBS.
  • To fill an application form, candidates need to register themselves.
  • Applicants should be the resident of Uttar Pradesh State.
  • Candidates should belong from the Indian Citizenship
  • The age of the candidates should be a minimum of be 17 years aged as of December 31, 2024.
  • The Maximum age is 25 years & 5 Years Extension is allowed for the Reserve categories like as SC/ST/OBC/PwD.
  • The candidates should be qualified class12 from the state don’t ought to be the resident of the state.
  • The candidates got to pass in Chemistry, Physics, and Biology in class12 or equivalent examination.
  • The candidates need to score a minimum of 50% in Chemistry, Physics, and Biology in aggregate in class12 or equivalent examination if belonging to the unreserved category.
  • For candidates belonging to the SC/ST/OBC category, scoring a minimum of 40% is mandatory whereas for PH candidates belonging to the unreserved category should score a minimum of 45%.

sections.title: Document Required for MBBS Admission Uttar Pradesh

content.list:
• MBBS admission application form in the prescribed format
  • NEET Hall Ticket or Admit Card
  • NEET Rank Card
  • NEET Score Card
  • A copy of the parents’ PAN Card Proof for the parents’ address and identity
  • AADHAR Card as address proof
  • At least 8 recent passport size photos of candidates
  • Cast Certificate
  • Character Certificate issued by the recently attended school or college
  • Class 12 Mark sheet Class XII Passing Certificate
  • Date of Birth (D.O.B.) Certificate
  • Family Income Proof
  • Medical Fitness Certificate
  • Migration Certificate Domicile Certificate
  • Prepaid Fee Receipt
  • Provisional Seat Allotment Letter/ Call Letter
  • Transfer Certificate issued by the recently attended school or college

sections.title: Uttar Pradesh MBBS Admission 2025-26: Reservation Criteria

content.list:
• In accordance with government regulations, under Uttar Pradesh NEET Counselling 2025, 15% of the seats in government colleges would be reserved for MBBS/BDS programmes on an All India basis. There will be 24 seats designated for applicants chosen from the Central Government pool, 4 in each of Uttar Pradesh State Medical Colleges (6 Government colleges). These positions will be filled by the Central Government Authority.
  • The remaining 85% of seats are covered by the state quota and will be filled in the Uttar Pradesh MBBS and BDS admissions 2025-26 on the basis of merit and preference, with reservations for the following categories
